message.content:
cs.IR, cs.EC, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the application of Learning to Rank (LETOR) for E-Commerce search, which involves information retrieval (IR) and machine learning (ML) techniques. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the challenges in feature representation, obtaining reliable relevance judgments, and optimally exploiting multiple user feedback signals, which are related to the sub-categories of cs.CL (Computational Linguistics) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the practical aspects of E-Commerce search, which are related to the sub-category of cs.EC (E-Commerce). Finally, the paper reports experiments on industry data sets, which are related to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society).
